label: Description
value: Patchwork medallion with a star pattern in unbleached cotton and three roller-printed cottons in browns, tans and pinks. Handwritten in dark brown ink in the center circle; "Olivia C. Whitridge, New Bedford, 1853"

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: pieced and sewn patchwork of plain and roller-printed fabrics

label: Description
value: Quatrefoil-shaped tray of white porcelain with four equal lobes and two assymetrical, gilt, leaf-form handles; gilt, rippled rim; in center, floral spray, small flowers scattered on background.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Dimensions
value: H x W x D: 2.4 x 33 x 33 cm (15/16 in. x 13 in. x 13 in.)

label: Description
value: a) Assymetrically-shaped white porcelain vegetable dish with two handles and b) cover with gilt curved finial. Both are decorated with floral sprays and strewn flowers, rippled and gilt rococo borders and pale blue areas.

label: Physical description
value: hard paste porcelain, vitreous enamel, gold

label: Description
value:
Rectangular cabinet with slightly projecting central section consisting of four-shelved cupboard concealed by vertical double doors over shallow horizontal drawer. Side section consists of open upper shelf with fluted corner colonette over four small drawers over single door. Stepped cornice, molded base, six ball feet. Extensive ivory inlay on doors, drawers, framing, sides with most important motif being a female figure with attributes on each center door. Ivory drawer pulls; drawers lined with dark red velvet; key. On each center door, inside top, ivory plaque with name: "Soubrier."

A- base
B- back panel
C-right cabinet 
D-left cabinet 
E- right door
F- left door
G- drawer 
H- top 
I - key 
Also two small panels on 5th fl. 11-B

label: Description
value: "Landscape" rebozo made of three continuous bands between four multicolored bands. The scenic bands are made up of groups of figures in various poses engaged in a variety of activities – play of various instruments, singing and outdoor pleasures. Note the bouquet in the center of the middle band, the two ships in the bottom band to the right of center, the two figures being burned at the stake in bottom band extreme right, two stakes being prepared and not yet set on fire directly above in the top band. Two representations of a ball on a string held by three figures.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal Technique: (foundation) warp-faced plain weave; embroidered

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 206 x 78.5 cm (6 ft. 9 1/8 in. x 30 7/8 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. J. B. Campbell

label: Description
value: Bentwood armchair with caned seat, two scrolling armrests, circular "stretcher" and four tapered legs.  Armrests on each side terminate in scrolls.

label: Provenance
value: Thonet Industries, Inc.; 1971: acquired by Museum

label: Notes
value: Bentwood armchair with caned seat, two scrolling armrests, circular "stretcher" and four tapered legs. Armrests on each side terminate in scrolls.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cardboard, linen, silk, metallic Technique: Machine made net and lace. See notes for additional information.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The George Walter Vincent Smith Art Museum

label: Description
value:
Samples of machine-made openwork and several examples of hand made lace mounted on boards. They imitate hand-embroidered net, crochet, or needlepoint.  All are floral patterns plus a few of early 1920's geometric style.
"Embroidered net" produced by the Schiffli Machine.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cardboard, linen Technique: Levers Machine

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (card): 35.6 x 27.9 cm (14 x 11 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of The George Walter Vincent Smith Art Museum

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cardboard, linen, silk, metallic Technique: linen embroidery with ground cloth dissolved Examples of embroidery on net produced by the Schiffli machine Metallic embroidery on net Machine-made openwork in imitation of hand-embroidered net Mostly floral and a few geometric patterns, some designs described as "Spanish" Imitation hand-made filet Machine filet Imitation filet crochet Ploven (burnt-out lace) Fancy curtain lace made on the Levers machines Real filet (handmade) next to Machine-made filet Spotted curtain nets, made chiefly at Nottingham, England and Caudry, France.
